Call_General.name: Calll
Call_General.description: A call is a generic term for an invitation to submit content. Usually, content is collected in a Submission Phase and reviewed afterwards in a Review Phase by a group of reviewers.

Call_Configuration_HeaderImage.name: Header / Banner Image
Call_Configuration_HeaderImage.description: Upload a banner image file that you want to appear in your call page. Best dimensions are 4x1 (WxH), e.g. w1600 x h400.

Call_Configuration_Communication.name: Communication / Notifications
Call_Configuration_Communication.description: Updates in the system can trigger notifications to reviewers and submitters. Configure how frequently these notifications should be delivered.

Call_Configuration_ReviewPrivacy.name: Review Privacy
Call_Configuration_ReviewPrivacy.description: To minimize bias, it may be necessary to conceal identity or certain information about the submitter from reviewers. This setting controls the level of privacy

Call_Configuration_ReviewerAllocation.name: Reviewer Allocation
Call_Configuration_ReviewerAllocation.description: This setting controls how submissions that require a review get assigned to a reviewer as a request to review. Configure how reviews are allocated to the reviewer pool. When a new submission arrives, it can either remain unassigned (manual, so that you can manually assign it) or automatically be assigned to one reviewer from the pool, either randomly, to the reviewer with the least number of outstanding reviews (queue) or to the reviewer who our machine learning algorithm determines has the shortest expected review completion time.

Call_Configuration_ReviewerAllocationPoo.name: Reviewer Pool
Call_Configuration_ReviewerAllocationPoo.description: Select or create group of users among who will be chosen who will be assigned as the reviewer for each new submission. This will be selected according to the Review Allocation mechanism, and is disabled for manual allocation.

Call_Configuration_ReviewerPool.name: Reviewer Pool
Call_Configuration_ReviewerPool.description: Select or create group of users among who will be chosen who will be assigned as the reviewer for each new submission. This will be selected according to the Review Allocation mechanism, and is disabled for manual allocation.

Call_Attribute_Name.name: Call Name
Call_Attribute_Name.description: This is the name of the call that will be seen by everyone—submitters, reviewers, administrators, and the public.

Call_Attribute_Introduction.name: Call Introduction
Call_Attribute_Introduction.description: The introduction to a call will appear together with the Call Name on the Call Detail page. Edit this introduction to address all prospective submitters—and include information about the call, guidelines, and submission instructions.

Call_Configuration_Timezone.name: Call Timezone
Call_Configuration_Timezone.description: Choose the time zone of the location for the call. This will ensure the times you specify as deadlines will be enforced in this timezone.

CallPhases_General.name: Call Phases
CallPhases_General.description: As an administrator, you can add submission and review phases to handle submissions to a call. Add at least one submission phase to receive submissions to the call. Also, add at least one review phase for reviewing submissions. Be sure to set the Times for each phase such that no phase overlaps any other. If care isn’t taken to avoid this, then submitters might submit to the wrong phase.

CallPhases_Times.name: Times
CallPhases_Times.description: Set the start and end date of this phase. If you are establishing multiple phases, ensure that that there are no two submission phases that have overlapping dates (review phases may overlap)

CallPhases_SubmissionForm.name: Submission Form
CallPhases_SubmissionForm.description: Create the form for this submission phase. Add sections to the form and configure each section with fields, options and other features.

CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_Group.name: Who can submit?
CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_Group.description: Set the access restrictions for types of users who can submit into this phase. A variety of different types of restrictions are available.

CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_NameGenera.name: Submission Name
CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_NameGenera.description: Specify the scheme for identifying each submission to this phase. Choose from running numbers, colors, a random number, or the contents of a field in the submission form.

CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_AllowWithd.name: Allow Submission Withdrawal
CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_AllowWithd.description: Indicate here whether you will accept the withdrawal of a submission. The setting you choose here applies to all submitters to this phase.

CallPhases_ReviewForm.name: Review Form
CallPhases_ReviewForm.description: Create the form for this review phase. Add sections to the form and configure each section with fields, options and other features.

CallPhases_ReviewSettings_Group.name: Reviewer Group
CallPhases_ReviewSettings_Group.description: Set the access restrictions for types of users who can review submissions in this phase.

FormEditor_Forms.name: Forms
FormEditor_Forms.description: Create forms to be used in the template.

FormEditor_Sections.name: Form Section
FormEditor_Sections.description: A section is a visual distinction between fields and has a name that will be rendered at the beginning of the section.

FormEditor_SectionName.name: Form Section name
FormEditor_SectionName.description: name that will be rendered at the top of each section.

FormEditor_Fields.name: Form Field
FormEditor_Fields.description: A field is what the user who fills out the form will fill in, e.g. a text field. Each field has a name and several options, some of which are related to the field-type, others are generic (e.g. whether the field is optional)

FormEditor_FieldName.name: Field Label
FormEditor_FieldName.description: The label that will be displayed on each field.

FormEditor_FieldOptional.name: Optional Field
FormEditor_FieldOptional.description: The field is not required to be filled out.

FormEditor_FieldIsPrivateSubmission.name: Invisible field to submitter
FormEditor_FieldIsPrivateSubmission.description: Use this option to indicate that a certain field is invisible to the user filling out the form.

FormEditor_FieldIsPrivateReviewBlind.name: Invisible field during blind review
FormEditor_FieldIsPrivateReviewBlind.description: The value captured from the submitter will not be displayed to the reviewer if this option is checked, AND the review settings are set to Blind Review.

FormEditor_FieldIsPrivateReview.name: Invisible field during review
FormEditor_FieldIsPrivateReview.description: The value captured from the submitter will not be displayed to the reviewer if this option is checked.

FormEditor_FieldSkipLogic.name: Skip Logic
FormEditor_FieldSkipLogic.description: Mark certain fields on the form as only visible/required if selected options of the Skip Logic Field are chosen. E.g. a dropdown for “category” could mark follow-up questions to each category as only required if the respective category was selected first and hide the irrelevant follow-up questions otherwise.

CallPhases_PhaseDependencies.name: Phase Dependencies
CallPhases_PhaseDependencies.description: Phases in a template follow a certain structure. There can be an arbitrary number of submission phases, and each submission phase can have review phases that depend on it.

UserGroups_General.name: User Groups
UserGroups_General.description: Users in the system can be grouped, and those groups can be given a name. When configuring a call, you can search through user groups and find the group that you created as the reviewer group for that particular call, or add a restriction to only allow submissions from such a group.

Review_CannotReviewRightNow.name: No Review Required
Review_CannotReviewRightNow.description: At this point there is no review required from you - Please ensure you are accessing the correct submission to review, and that the review phase is currently active.

Submission_Message_To_Submitter.name: Bulk Message to Submitters
Submission_Message_To_Submitter.description: Select the users you would like to send a bulk message to. In the dialog you can configure subject and message body to be sent.

Submission_Tags.name: Tagging Submissions
Submission_Tags.description: Tags are categories you can assign to submissions, either in bulk or individually. No need to define which categories you need, simply create a new tag on the fly. Fully utilize the power of tags by building custom views to filter for only certain tags.

Jobs_Introduction.name: Jobs
Jobs_Introduction.description: Jobs are an advanced feature that allow monitoring and controlling long-running tasks. Contact support for further details.

SubmissionNotAllowed.name: Cannot submit right now
SubmissionNotAllowed.description: You cannot make a submission to this call at this time. The administrator has configured that only certain accounts are able to submit during certain times. It appears the account you're submitting from doesn't meet those criteria. We recommend you get in touch with the call administrator directly if further clarification is required.

Call_CommitteeSelection.name: Committe Selection Call
Call_CommitteeSelection.description: The Committe Selection Call has a custom template

StatusMessage_Submission_Not_Found.name: Submission Not Found
StatusMessage_Submission_Not_Found.description: We could not find the submission you are trying to view. Double-check the link/url and try again.

StatusMessage_Review_Not_Found.name: Review Not Found
StatusMessage_Review_Not_Found.description: We could not find the review you are trying to view. Double-check the link/url and try again.

StatusMessage_Review_Error.name: Review Error
StatusMessage_Review_Error.description: Our servers weren't able to obtain the requested review. This is most likely to be an error in our servers, and we recommend you get in touch with support.

StatusMessage_PageNotFound404.name: Not Found
StatusMessage_PageNotFound404.description: The page you requested to view doesn't exist, or has been moved or deleted. Double-check the link/url and try again.

CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_AlwaysBCC.name: Email Blind Copy
CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_AlwaysBCC.description: Check this box to blind/bcc-copy specific e-mail addresses for any event happening in this phase. In the field, separate each email address with a comma. Whoever receives the original notification will not know that these email addresses also received the notification.

CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_MaxSubmiss.name: Maximum Number of Submissions per Submitter
CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_MaxSubmiss.description: Set the maximum number of submissions that you will allow for a single submitter.

CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_Restrictio.name: Regular Expression
CallPhases_SubmissionSettings_Restrictio.description: Use a regular expression to describe a restriction on a property. Learn how to build regular expressions using e.g. https://regexone.com

CallPhases_ReviewSettings_EventCommunica.name: Event Communication / Notifications
CallPhases_ReviewSettings_EventCommunica.description: Updates in the system can trigger notifications to administrators, reviewers, and submitters. The administrator can configure the frequency of these notifications.

CallPhases_ReviewSettings_AlwaysBCC.name: Email Blind Copy
CallPhases_ReviewSettings_AlwaysBCC.description: Check this box to blind/bcc-copy specific e-mail addresses for any event happening in this phase. In the field, separate each email address with a comma. Whoever receives the original notification will not know that these email addresses also received the notification.

CallPhases_PaymentOption.name: Require Payment ot Submit
CallPhases_PaymentOption.description: Configure to enforce that to make a submission a payment has to be made. Select the payment processor to use (e.g. Impexium, or Stripe) and which product should be used to process the payment.

Mail_EventTypes.name: Notification Events
Mail_EventTypes.description: Some events are configurable to send a notification message when the event occurs. Choose which event applies to this message template.

Mail_Placeholders.name: Placeholders
Mail_Placeholders.description: Define custom content for any of notifications that are sent for the event type chosen in the drop-down. These placeholders help you to mention specific aspects of the event, call, organization, submission, or recipient name (reviewer name).

Mail_Subject.name: Subject
Mail_Subject.description: Much like the subject of an email message. Enter the subject of the notification that will be sent to the recipient.

Mail_Content.name: Content
Mail_Content.description: Enter the main content of the message in the rich-text editor.

Query_CustomView.name: Custom View
Query_CustomView.description: Customize a view to suit your needs and customize both the filters and the result fields. Custom views can be saved, shared and exported.

Query_ResultFields.name: Result Fields
Query_ResultFields.description: Customize which columns will be displayed and included in the export. Choose from all fields in the submission form, review form, and a variety of system provided fields such as “Review Score” and “Tags”.

Query_FilterCriteria.name: Filter Criteria
Query_FilterCriteria.description: Add filters to your query, that limit the results it retrieves to only include those who match. Choose from all fields in the submission form, review form, and a variety of system provided fields such as “Review Score” and “Tags”.

Query_LoadView.name: Saving and Loading a Custom View
Query_LoadView.description: Save a custom view so that you can later load it again. Use this feature to maintain a variety of different views and load them when required.

Query_Share.name: Sharing a Custom View
Query_Share.description: A custom view can be shared with your colleagues. Upon sharing, they will find the view in the 'Load View' list.

Query_Default.name: Default View
Query_Default.description: Mark a custom view as default for a call to automatically load it when viewing the list of submission in the call.

Query_Export.name: Exporting
Query_Export.description: You may “Export” or “Export All” the submissions you are currently viewing (including the Filter Criteria and Result Fields as configured in the Custom View). Export All allows a seamless export if there are more than 50 submissions.

Review_Assignment.name: Modify Submission Reviewer
Review_Assignment.description: On each submission, or in bulk, configure who is assigned to review a submission. Search the user database to find the reviewer. You can remove an existing reviewer who hasn’t completed their assignment.

Submission_Status.name: Accept/Reject Submission
Submission_Status.description: Submissions have states: Open (default), Accepted and Rejected. These are not visible to the submitter or reviewer and trigger no notifications in the system. They can be changed back to Open or otherwise at any time. You may filter for the status.

Submission_Phase.name: Manage call phase
Submission_Phase.description: In a configuration where multiple review phases overlap, the admin controls in which phase a submission is. To trigger e.g. a “Senior Review”, the admin moves the submission to the “Senior Review” phase.

Submission_ReviewImport.name: Importing Reviews
Submission_ReviewImport.description: In an environment where no stable internet connection is available, reviews may be conducted offline. You can generate a template, take this in Excel and fill out offline, then import it later to apply the reviews.

Submission_BulkActions.name: Bulk Actions
Submission_BulkActions.description: Select multiple submissions to apply certain actions to all selected. You may choose to tag, accept/reject or modify the review assignment or call phase. In addition the following actions are available only as bulk-actions: Sending a message to selected submission authors, and importing reviews; In an environment where no stable internet connection is available, reviews may be conducted offline. You can generate a template, take this in Excel and fill out offline, then import it later to apply the reviews.

FormEditor_limited.name: FormEditor limited editing
FormEditor_limited.description: Submissions have been recieved for this form, you can only change the labels of the fields and static text

AuthorRoles.name: Print author roles
AuthorRoles.description: Checking this causes primary authors to be printed with an asterisk(*)

SubscribeCalendar.name: How to subscribe to your appointments
SubscribeCalendar.description:
On this tab you can additionally export your appointment data into an external calendar e.g. Google/Outlook Calendar or even on your phone. To do this:


On the top-left corner of this page click Subscribe Calendar.
Copy the URL link displayed.
In an external calendar of your choice (e.g. Google Calendar) find the option to Add a New Calendar using URL.
Paste your copied URL from Slayte into this space provided to paste a new calendar URL.
Save changes.
